pull.title: qa: Remove redundant checkmempool/checkblockindex extra_args
pull.body:
They are already enabled by default for regtest:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/df9f71274645a917e2578c52a1c59745bce8112d/src/init.cpp#L1002-L1007



Closes  #13912. CC #12138

verification.payload:
tree 1d065c1917f17c836b346dda97d8a70a91556eaf
parent df9f71274645a917e2578c52a1c59745bce8112d
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1533753009 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1533752959 -0400

qa: Remove redundant checkmempool/checkblockindex extra_args

events.body: Concept ACK. Could be interesting to disable these settings and see which tests require them.

utACK fa31ca0c22b35beaceaf131b8f598280abdfd58d.

@Empact: Why should any tests "require" these settings at all?  They just make sure the tests enforce more things, no?

utACK fa31ca0

@domob1812 I'm not that familiar with the checks, e.g. wrt to whether they have any side-effects, so I was curious to explore the counterfactual - if the checks are explicitly active now, and removing the explicit activation leaves them active by default, what happens if the default changes? Ran the affected tests with regtest `fDefaultConsistencyChecks = false`, and each passed, so seems good to me.
